name: Begum Khaleda Zia

previous: Prime Minister of Bangladesh (1991-1996, 2001-2006)
Leader of the Opposition (1996-2001, 2008-2014)

political_career.event: Entered active politics after Ziaur Rahman's assassination; became BNP Chairperson in 1984
Served as Prime Minister (three terms, with major policy reforms)
Released; acquitted in remaining cases; nominated for upcoming election

election_constituencies.election_area_name: porshuram Upazila, chagolnaiya upazila, fulgazi upozila

life_activities: Leading BNP, nationwide political mobilization
overall_summary: Begum Khaleda Zia (born 15 August 1945) is the Chairperson of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) and one of the most influential figures in Bangladesh’s modern political history. As the country’s first female Prime Minister, she served three terms between 1991 and 2006, overseeing key democratic transitions after years of military rule. Known for her resilience and mass appeal, she continues to symbolise BNP’s leadership despite health challenges and political restrictions. In recent years, she has been re-nominated to contest from Feni-1, Bogura-7, and Dinajpur-3.

name: Tarique Rahman

latest: Acting Chairman, BNP (2018 - Present)
previous: Senior Vice Chairman, BNP (2009-2018)

political_career.event: Joined BNP at grassroots (Bogura)
Senior Joint Secretary General, BNP
Assumed role of Acting Chairman

life_activities: Leading party strategy from exile; party mobilisation
overall_summary: Tarique Rahman (born 20 November 1965) is the Acting Chairman of BNP and the eldest son of former President Ziaur Rahman and Begum Khaleda Zia. A key figure in party strategy and organisational reform, he is known for his influence on BNP’s youth base and his role in shaping the party’s digital and overseas presence. Currently living in exile in London, he remains a decisive voice in BNP’s policymaking and has been nominated to contest from Bogura-6.

overall_summary: Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir (born 26 January 1948) is the Secretary General of BNP and a seasoned economist and parliamentarian. With decades of political experience, he has served as one of the party’s principal spokespersons and strategists during times of crisis. Widely respected for his calm and disciplined leadership, Fakhrul represents the party’s moderate reformist wing and has been announced as the BNP candidate for Thakurgaon-1.

A former State Minister and multiple-term Member of Parliament from Cox’s Bazar-1, he has played a significant role in BNP’s national and local-level policy coordination. A lawyer by profession, he continues to be an active organiser in the Chattogram division and has been nominated again for Cox’s Bazar-1.

overall_summary: Dr. Khandaker Mosharraf Hossain (born 1 October 1946) is a veteran BNP Standing Committee member and an academic-turned-politician. With a PhD in Geology from Imperial College London, he previously served as a cabinet minister in several key departments. Known for his expertise in development policy and governance, Dr. Hossain remains an influential voice in BNP’s policymaking. He is closely associated with Cumilla-2 constituency, representing the Chattogram division.

overall_summary: Mirza Abbas (born 7 February 1951) is a prominent BNP Standing Committee member, businessman, and former Mayor of Dhaka City Corporation. A long-time leader in Dhaka politics, he also served as Minister of Housing and Public Works (2001–2006). His influence extends across both political and business circles, notably as one of the founders of Dhaka Bank. He has been named BNP’s candidate for Dhaka-8 in the upcoming election.

overall_summary: Dr. Abdul Moyeen Khan (born 1 January 1947) is a senior BNP Standing Committee member, physicist, and former cabinet minister. Educated at the University of Sussex and the University of Dhaka, he served as MP for Narsingdi-2 and held ministerial portfolios in successive BNP governments. His intellectual approach and emphasis on democratic reform make him one of the most respected figures within the party. He is contesting again from Narsingdi-2.

Known for his organisational work and close connection with local communities, he continues to play a key role in BNP’s grassroots mobilisation in the Rangpur division.

Known for his modern campaign style and focus on youth inclusion, he has emerged as a prominent figure in Dhaka city politics.

As the founder of the Chittagong Stock Exchange, he played a pioneering role in developing Bangladesh’s financial sector. A respected policymaker, he continues to guide BNP’s economic and trade policy. He represents Chattogram city constituencies and remains an influential figure in national politics.

Formerly the personal physician to Begum Khaleda Zia, he has transitioned into an active political organiser, particularly in northern Bangladesh. His dual background in medicine and public service gives him a unique profile within BNP’s senior ranks, and he is currently active in the Dinajpur region.

Having served multiple terms as MP from Bhola-3, he is known for his disciplined leadership, integrity, and long-Standing contribution to Bangladesh’s liberation and political history. He remains an influential figure in Barishal division politics.
